intro: Lipochaeta robusta, commonly known as the robust lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in dense inflorescences, often surrounded by bracts. Lipochaeta robusta is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
